messages.title: A New Face for Newbury
messages.content: Alex Skirvin: We need an MP who reflects your values. My family shaped in me the values of hard work, fairness and equality. My mother's a retired NHS nurse, my father works for a brewery and my stepmother works in a supermarket. I live and work here - it's my home. It's a beautiful place filled with hard work and thoroughly decent people whose values aren't reflected in Richard Benyon's voting record.

messages.title: I am backing Alex
messages.content: "I believe that Alex Skirvin will fight to defend jobs, businesses, schools and the NHS. We need an MP who will work for everybody in the area, with all their concerns. I know that he wants to make sure elderly people can live in health and dignity, and that young people can get a good education, and a future that includes secure jobs and decent, affordable housing." - Alan Rivers, Retired businessman

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We need an education system that doesn't segregate children.
Ensure our elderly can grow old with dignity.
Ensure nobody needs to be poor and jobless.
Affordable housing is a right not a privilege.

mentions.tacticalSituation: I know what you, like me, worry about more than Brexit. We don't need a rerun of the referendum, what we want is an MP who will defend us against cuts that mean our children can't afford a house, and leave adults falling into a lifetime of debt.

issues.education: We need an education system that doesn't segregate children.
issues.health: We need an MP who will fight to defend the NHS. Save our NHS from privatisation.
issues.labourEmployment: I can promise to defend jobs. Yes to defending jobs and businesses. Nobody needs to be poor and jobless.
issues.socialWelfare: Ensure our elderly can grow old with dignity. Affordable housing is a right not a privilege.

community.content: Richard Benyon couldn't stop or even reduce the savage cuts to the budget of West Berks District Council by his own ministers. He allowed sweeping cuts to public services, such as libraries, and slashed budgets for struggling families.

contactInformation.address: Flat 3 Chapel Gates, 69 Newtown Road, Newbury RG14 7DA
